name: Kimchi Pancakes (Kimchijeon)
description: A vegan version of Korean Kimchijeon, or Kimchi Pancakes. My go-to order at Korean restaurants.
recipeIngredient: 210 grams (1 cup) vegan kimchi, chopped (homemade recipe HERE)
70 grams (1/2 cup) Korean wheat pancake mix (substitute: all-purpose flour)
1 tablespoon gochugaru, or Korean chili flakes
1 pinch gochugaru, or Korean chili flakes

recipeInstructions.name: Make Dipping Sauce. Mix all dipping sauce ingredients together and taste to adjust. Set aside. You can also store this in the refrigerator for future use. Note: the dipping sauce is made first to allow time for flavors to infuse & deepen.
recipeInstructions.text: Make Dipping Sauce. Mix all dipping sauce ingredients together and taste to adjust. Set aside. You can also store this in the refrigerator for future use. Note: the dipping sauce is made first to allow time for flavors to infuse & deepen.

recipeInstructions.name: Make the Batter. In a large mixing bowl, combine chopped kimchi, Korean wheat pancake mix (or all purpose flour), ice-cold water, gochugaru, and scallions. Mix until a smooth batter forms. You can add a little extra kimchi juice or water if the batter is too thick. Note: do not over-mix the batter, so as to minimize gluten development.

Mix until a smooth batter forms. You can add a little extra kimchi juice or water if the batter is too thick. Note: do not over-mix the batter, so as to minimize gluten development.

recipeInstructions.name: Make the Pancakes. Heat up a generous amount of oil non-stick or cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. (oil should cover the whole surface of the pan). Since this recipe makes two pancakes, start by pouring half of the batter in. Note: how many pancakes you make depends on the size of your pan. Spread the batter out evenly to a thin, round shape and fry until the edges begin to look golden-brown, about 3-4 minutes. Right before you flip the pancake, add about 1 tablespoon more oil. Carefully flip the pancake and cook until the other side becomes crispy golden-brown. Note: you can turn the heat up slightly towards the end of cooking to get the pancake even crispier. Once cooked, remove the pancake from the pan and repeat until no more batter is left. Slice diagonally into 6-8 pieces. Serve warm with the dipping sauce.
